https://prez.dev/description.@value: A categorization of disciplines or topics that the broad field of Earth science can be subdivided into, i.e. a listing of the Fields of Research, or subjects, to which a geoscience dataset, publication, observation/activity, or entity pertains. The vocabulary also contains relevant disciplines that intersect with the various Earth science fields, such as biological sciences and built environment and design, as well as entries related to collection and heritage management. Notations included are those from the 2020 ANZSRC listing (see History Note) or in common use in the geoscience community.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#defi.@value: The study of tiny encapsulations of fluids that trap oil, gas, water and solid phases in minerals and rocks to determine parameters such as temperature, pressure, salinity, density and depth of trapping — thereby providing direct information about the conditions of formation. In the case of hydrocarbon exploration, these studies are conducted to assess the fluid history of the rock/sedimentary basin and the prevailing thermal conditions, to determine whether oil and gas are likely to be found at a particular location, as well as the source and type of hydrocarbon present.

http://www.w3.org/2004/02/skos/core#hist.@value: Compiled by Geological Survey of Western Australia from multiple sources.
